Compute activity counts using [citation] algorithm

Source: R/mims_unit.R
mims_unit.Rd

Compute activity counts using [citation] algorithm

mims_unit(df, breaks = "5 sec", range, noise_level = 0.03, k = 0.05,
  spar = 0.6, filter_type = "butter", cutoffs = c(0.2, 5),
  integration = "trapz", axes = c(2, 3, 4), use_extrapolation = TRUE,
  use_interpolation = TRUE, use_filtering = TRUE,
  combination = "sum", vm_after_extrapolation = FALSE,
  allow_truncation = TRUE, output_per_axis = FALSE,
  output_orientation = FALSE, breaks_for_orientation = NULL,
  before_df = NULL, after_df = NULL)

Arguments

df

input sensor data frame that fits the mhealth specification
breaks

epoch to compute counts on
range

dynamic range of the device (two element vector)
noise_level

noise level should be between 0.01 and 0.1
k

neighborhood duration for extrapolation in seconds, default is 0.05 seconds
spar

smoothing parameter for extrapolation, default is 0.6
cutoffs

cut off frequencies to be used in filtering, default is 0.2Hz and 5Hz. If choosing bessel, the low pass cut off would be multipled by 2 when being used.
integration

the integration method to be used: 'trapz', 'absoluteMeanByPoints'.
allow_truncation

use zero truncation or not, default is TRUE
resample

set 0 to not use resampling, otherwise set to the desired sampling rate in numerical, e.g 40 for 40Hz. Default is 50.
filter

'butter', 'ellip', 'bessel'

Value

Will return NA if a segment break is too short to have enough samples to compute AUC

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
